means: 允诺( promise的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The Prime Minister has promised that Israel will play a constructive role.
sentence.Network_cn: 首相承诺以色列将发挥积极的作用。

sentence.Network_en: Melanie promised that she would call them in the morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 梅拉妮许诺第二天上午给他们打电话。

sentence.Network_en: Would Bethany return of her own free will, as she had promised?
sentence.Network_cn: 贝萨妮会像她承诺的那样自愿回来吗？

PerfectNetExp.abs: you promised you would never see him again ., 你答应过你不在见他.
you promised me the son of jor - ei ., 你答应给我乔尔的儿子.
The UK Government has promised to champion the need for an arms trade treaty ., 英国政府承诺将维护武器贸易条约的建立.
the police promised to look into the matter ., 警察承诺要调查这个事件.

i'll miss you_百度百科 ... I’ll fly away tonight 今晚就要起程 I promise 我发誓 I won’t let you cry 不让你哭泣.
蒲公英的约定(Dandelion's promise) Pu gong ying de yue dingComposer: Jay Chou (周杰伦) (周杰伦)Lyricist: Vincent Fang (方文.

entry.def: If you promise that you will do something, you say to someone that you will definitely do it.

example.ex: The post office has promised to resume first class mail delivery to the area on Friday...
example.tran: 邮局承诺于星期五恢复对这个地区第一类邮件的递送。

example.ex: He had promised that the rich and privileged would no longer get preferential treatment...
example.tran: 他已经保证富人和特权阶层不会再得到优惠待遇。

entry.tran: 答应给予；承诺给予；保证让…得到
entry.def: If you promise someone something, you tell them that you will definitely give it to them or make sure that they have it.

example.ex: In 1920 the great powers promised them an independent state...
example.tran: 1920年，列强承诺让他们成为一个独立的国家。

example.ex: The officers promise a return to multiparty rule.
example.tran: 这些官员承诺恢复多党统治。

entry.def: A promise is a statement which you make to a person in which you say that you will definitely do something or give them something.

example.ex: If you make a promise, you should keep it...
example.tran: 如果做出了承诺，就应该遵守。

example.ex: The program has lived up to its promise to promote family welfare.
example.tran: 这个项目恪守了其改善家庭福利的承诺。

entry.def: If a situation or event promises to have a particular quality or to be a particular thing, it shows signs that it will have that quality or be that thing.

example.ex: While it will be fun, the seminar also promises to be most instructive.
example.tran: 这次的研讨会不仅会有趣，而且有可能会颇具启发意义。

entry.tran: （非常好的或成功的）希望，迹象，指望
entry.def: If someone or something shows promise, they seem likely to be very good or successful.

example.ex: The boy first showed promise as an athlete in grade school.
example.tran: 这个男孩在上小学的时候就初次显示出成为运动员的潜力。

auth_sentence.content: Wolinski, however, had promised it to Rufus.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wolinski, however, had promised it to Rufus.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wolinski, however, had promised it to Rufus.

auth_sentence.content: The IOC has promised to look at the issue.
auth_sentence.res_content: The IOC has promised to look at the issue.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The IOC has promised to look at the issue.

Sentence.sentence: As baby boomers(二战后婴儿潮时期出生的人) came of high-school age, big schools promised economic efficiency.
David promised to go on the trip in her place.
